front.question: When assessing an elderly male who complains of nausea and generalized weakness, you find that he takes atorvastatin (Lipitor) and amlodipine (Norvasc). These medications suggest a history of:

choices: enhances the effects of another medication when given in a higher dose.
blocks receptor sites and prevents other chemicals from attaching to them.
stimulates receptor sites and allows other chemicals to attach to them.
produces a cumulative effect when mixed with the same type of medication.
front.question: A medication with antagonistic properties is one that:

cards.back: blocks receptor sites and prevents other chemicals from attaching to them.

choices: MDIs are contraindicated for patients with asthma or emphysema.
MDIs are most commonly used by patients with cardiovascular disease.
Shaking an MDI prior to use will cause deactivation of the medication.
An MDI delivers the same amount of medication every time it is used.
front.question: Which of the following statements regarding the metered-dose inhaler (MDI) is correct?

cards.back: An MDI delivers the same amount of medication every time it is used.

front.question: Aspirin is beneficial to patients suspected of having a heart attack because it:

choices: the study of drug excretion from the human body.
the study of drugs that are produced illegally.
the study of drugs and their actions on the body.
the study of how medications affect the brain.
front.question: The term “pharmacology” is MOST accurately defined as:

cards.back: the study of drugs and their actions on the body.

choices: Glucose is a simple sugar that is readily absorbed by the cells.
Glucose is given to patients who are suspected of being hyperglycemic.
Glucose is a complex sugar that rapidly absorbs into the bloodstream.
Glucose is usually administered by the EMT via the intravenous route.
front.question: Which of the following statements regarding glucose is correct?

cards.back: Glucose is a simple sugar that is readily absorbed by the cells.

front.question: The __________ of a medication usually dictates the route by which it will be administered.
The medical term for a low blood glucose level is:
Which of the following medication routes delivers a drug through the skin over an extended period of time, such as a nitroglycerin or fentanyl patch?
With the flowmeter set at 6 L/min, the nasal cannula will deliver up to _______ oxygen.
What medication form does oral glucose come in?
In ___________ administration, you are administering medication to yourself or your partner.
front.source: See Medication Administration and the EMT

choices: transport time to the hospital is greater than 30 minutes.
authorization from medical control has been obtained.
the patient is believed to be experiencing an acute stroke.
the patient is currently experiencing hypotension.
front.question: An EMT may administer aspirin to a patient if:
front.source: See General Steps in Administering Medication

cards.back: authorization from medical control has been obtained.

choices: Begin immediate transport and request an intercept with a paramedic ambulance.
Administer her epinephrine, reassess her condition, and transport her promptly.
Give her half the dose of her epinephrine in case her allergic reaction is delayed.
Begin transport to the hospital and closely monitor her condition while en route.
front.question: You are treating a 45-year-old woman who was stung by a hornet and has a rash. She tells you that she is allergic to hornets and has her own epinephrine auto-injector. She also tells you that she takes medication for hypertension. Her breath sounds do not reveal any wheezing, her breathing is unlabored, and her blood pressure is 154/94 mm Hg. What should you do if you are not able to make contact with medical control?

cards.back: Begin transport to the hospital and closely monitor her condition while en route.

front.question: Separation is especially an issue with medicine used as a(n):

choices: The epinephrine auto-injector delivers a preset amount of the drug.
The adult auto-injector delivers 0.5 to 1 mg of epinephrine.
EMTs do not need physician authorization to use the auto-injector.
The auto-injector delivers epinephrine via the subcutaneous route.
front.question: Which of the following statements regarding the epinephrine auto-injector is correct?

cards.back: The epinephrine auto-injector delivers a preset amount of the drug.

front.question: Which of the following is an example of a generic of a drug?

choices: Parenteral medications are absorbed by the body through the digestive system.
Parenteral medications are absorbed more quickly than enteral medications.
Compared to enteral medications, parenteral medications have fewer side effects.
Tylenol is an example of a parenteral medication because it is taken orally.
front.question: Which of the following statements regarding parenteral medications is correct?

cards.back: Parenteral medications are absorbed more quickly than enteral medications.

front.question: The process by which medications travel through body tissues until they reach the bloodstream is called:

choices: increases blood return to the right atrium.
constricts the veins throughout the body.
relaxes the walls of the coronary arteries.
front.question: Nitroglycerin, when given to patients with cardiac-related chest pain:

cards.back: relaxes the walls of the coronary arteries.
